column4: On Feisty, when I enable the 'desktop effects', the effects are properly loaded, but I lose the windows borders. Is there a way to fix it ?
re-enable your graphics card using System->Administrion->Restricted Manager drivers.
re-enable the graphic card after enabling the desktop effects ?
you need to re-enable the driver
you installed the driver manually didn't you..
yes, I did. And it is already loaded properly.
then disable and re-enable it using the Restricted Driver Manager. worked for me. needs to add an extra line in your xorg.conf
if you add this line yourself, dpkg will consider your config to be 'customised' and so it won't be upgraded. use the manager instead.
can you tell me what line is it ? I'm disabling it now thru Restricted Driver Manager and is removing from APT the driver !
that's normal. don't worry.
ok
I did what you said and it worked perfectly. Thanks for your help :D
great.. i can't remember what it was but ;)
ahah the restricted manager re-enabling. cool
it was about enabling the desktop effects.
